Event.Message: The file %1 may be corrupted, which may have caused the application %2 to stop working. Windows did not attempt to repair %1 because it is not a protected system file.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The system file %1 is corrupted, which may have caused the application %2 to stop working. Windows will not attempt to repair %1 because too many corrupted files have been detected recently. Frequent corruptions may indicate a problem with the disk on this computer.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The system file %1 may be corrupted, which may have caused the application %2 to stop working. Windows did not attempt to repair this file because the same file has been repaired too many times over a recent period of time.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The system file %1 is corrupted, which may have caused the application %2 to stop working. Windows did not attempt to repair this file because a repair attempt is already underway for the same file.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The system file %1 was reported as being corrupted but Windows determined that the file is not actually damaged. It may have been repaired already.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The system file %1 was corrupted, which may have caused the application %2 to stop working. Windows was unable to repair this file (error code %3). Run the command "sfc /scannow" at an administrative command prompt to check for errors and to repair the file if necessary.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ErrorCode" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message: The system file %1 was corrupted, which may have caused the application %2 to stop working. Windows successfully repaired the damaged file.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The system file %1 was corrupted, which may have caused the application %2 to stop working. Windows attempted to repair the file. A reboot is required to finish this repair.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The system file %1 may be corrupted, which may have caused the application %2 to stop working. Windows attempted to repair the file, but the operation was cancelled before it could be completed. Run the command "sfc /scannow" at an administrative command prompt to check for errors and to repair the file if necessary.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The system file %1 may be corrupted, but Windows could not determine if the file was actually damaged (error code %3). No repair action was taken. Run the command "sfc /scannow" at an administrative command prompt to check for errors and to repair the file if necessary.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ErrorCode" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message: The system file %1 is corrupted, which may have caused the application %2 to stop working. Windows could not attempt to repair %1 because a previous repair operation was pended. Reboot the computer and run the command "sfc /scannow" at an administrative command prompt to check for errors and to repair the file if necessary.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: Windows detected that program file %1 is corrupted, causing application %2 to stop working. To restore the file, reinstall %3 version %4.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FilePath" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductVersion" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The program file %1 was reported as being possibly corrupted, causing application %2 to stop working. Windows performed additional diagnostics and determined that the file is not actually damaged.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The file %1 may be corrupted, which may have caused the application %2 to stop working. Windows did not attempt to repair %1 because it could not find its corresponding installer package.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: Windows detected that program file %1 is corrupted, causing application %2 to stop working. Reinstalling %3 version %4 may repair the file. However, Windows is not launching a %3 reinstallation because too many product reinstalls have run recently.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FilePath" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductVersion" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: Windows detected that program file %1 is corrupted, causing application %2 to stop working. Reinstalling %3 version %4 may repair the file. However, Windows is not launching a %3 reinstallation because that product has already been reinstalled too many times recently.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FilePath" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductVersion" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The program file %1 was reported as being possibly corrupted, causing application %2 to stop working. Windows performed additional diagnostics and determined that the file is not an executable image. To avoid potential user data loss, Windows will not attempt to repair the file.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="FileName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AppName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>
